items.title: Homemade Chicken Parmesan: A Beginner’s Guide
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Homemade Chicken Parmesan: A Beginner’s Guide Recipes Homemade Chicken Parmesan: A Beginner’s Guide No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 53 Published: November 4, 2024 When it comes to home cooking, you can’t go wrong with a good ol’ chicken parmesan! When it comes to home cooking, you can’t go wrong with a good ol’ homemade chicken parmesan! This recipe keeps it warm and comforting like mom’s chicken parm, but places an emphasis on healthier ingredients and cooking methods. Prefer to Watch Instead of Read? The Appeal of a Good Homemade Chicken Parmesan Chicken parmesan can be made for just about any occasion. From weeknight meals to potlucks, and family gatherings to holiday dinners, it always hits the spot. Plus, it’s quick to make, is super filling, has a wonderful flavor, and is perfect for families. Our chicken parmesan recipe uses a secret weapon; mayonnaise! This makes sure your chicken stays super moist and tasty, and the panko crumbs help the chicken become extra crispy! Leftover chicken parm makes great fillings for sandwiches and wraps, or toppings for pasta and salads – helping you save time and money instead of having to take a trip to the store. You can store leftover chicken parmesan and eat it when you’re short on dinner ideas during the week. Homemade cooking is far more economical than eating out. It saves you money and often provides more than one meal! Takeout often contains additives and other unhealthy ingredients. With homemade cooking, you can switch up flavors, improve dishes, and change ingredients to fit your taste and diet preferences, whereas with takeout you are limited to what the restaurant offers. Preparing your meals yourself allows you to use leaner cuts of meat, cut down on sodium, avoid fat-heavy frying, and so much more! What Ingredients Do I Need for this Chicken Parm? The first thing you’ll need to do is to prep your ingredients. Here’s what you need to prepare this homemade chicken parmesan: 4 skinless chicken breast filets ½ cup of mayonnaise ¾ cup of shredded parmesan cheese 1 ½ cups of Panko bread crumbs 1 teaspoon of ground oregano 1 teaspoon of ground basil 1 cup of marinara sauce ½ cup of shredded mozzarella cheese If you want to swap or add anything, we have some suggestions below. Once that’s done, let’s start cooking! Looking for Ingredient Substitutions or Ideas? Sometimes less is more, and sometimes changing out ingredients is better. Everyone has a unique taste, and food is obviously no exception! So if you find yourself wanting to change up the dish or make it more “you”, we’ve got some potential ingredient swaps to help you get started! Super Cheesy – Instead of plain old Mozzarella, why not try a sharper provolone, another mild but savory cheese like fontina, or combine the mozzarella with Pecorino Romano for a combination of a mild creamy cheese with an earthy, salty taste? Healthier Sauce – Jarred sauces often contain higher sodium and ot

items.title: Chicken Chili Supper
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Soup, Stew, & Chili » Chicken Chili Supper Soup, Stew, & Chili Chicken Chili Supper No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 88 Published: October 28, 2024 Last Updated: December 6, 2024 Warm, hearty, and just spicy enough - this dinner is bound to become a winter time staple! My award-winning chicken chili supper has actually won a blue ribbon and a cook-off! First, with my mom’s help (I was a 5th grader at the time), I made this recipe for a 4-H contest. The second time my chicken chili recipe won was at work. At least eight co-workers entered their chili in the cook-off. The other employees were the taste testers and my chicken chili won first place again! My award was the afternoon off—those were fun times! If you want to get in on the award-winning action, you should definitely try this yummy chili! See How It’s Made A Quick Look Back on Chili Suppers American cuisine has included chili for a long time, especially during the winter when a warm, filling dinner is most appreciated. Although traditional chili is usually prepared using beef, several variations have developed including healthier, leaner chicken chili. My experience with chicken chili started in a tiny kitchen, inspired by a pinch of imagination mixed with necessity. I hope you try this recipe! How the Chicken Chili Supper Recipe Was Born As I mentioned above, my mom helped me make this chicken chili as a fifth-grader for a 4-H contest. The grocery store ran out of ground beef at that time, so we used chicken instead. Despite a potential setback, my mom turned it into a success story by hand-grinding the chicken. Besides earning me a blue ribbon, this innovative twist has also become part of our family tradition. A few years later, the same recipe won another contest at work, proving its ability to appeal to a wide range of taste buds. Chicken Chili Supper: Main Ingredients Here’s a list of the ingredients you’ll need. There are a few swap suggested in the FAQ section below so you can make it your own: 1 pound of ground chicken 1 sweet onion 1 clove of garlic 3 tablespoons of chili powder 1 teaspoon of cumin 1 teaspoon of dried oregano ½ teaspoon of cayenne pepper (use more or less to taste) 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar 2 cans of kidney beans 1 can of black beans 1 cup of salsa 1 cup of V8 juice (or plain tomato juice) 2 cups of chicken broth Ingredient Tips for the Chicken Chili Supper Ground Chicken : I recommend using chicken that has a bit of fat, ideally 85% lean and 15% fat. This balance ensures that the chili retains flavor without being too dry or greasy. Sweet Onion : While you could use any onion, sweet onion is mild and complements the spices of the chili well! Garlic : You can’t have chili without garlic, a staple in many chili dishes. You can add as much as you like! Chili Powder : The flavor of the chili comes mainly from the chili powder. Although trustworthy brands like McCormick or Mexene offer reliab

items.title: Best Ever Chicken and Rice Casserole
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Casseroles » Best Ever Chicken and Rice Casserole Casseroles Best Ever Chicken and Rice Casserole No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 33 Published: October 21, 2024 Busy weekdays don’t have to turn into busy evenings, thanks to this easy casserole. There’s nothing easier and more comforting in the world than a casserole. Busy weekdays don’t have to turn into busy nights with this simple chicken and rice casserole! Its main benefit is to provide you and your family with an easy and delicious meal but with that comes the use of “faster” ingredients. This is a well-rounded recipe as is, but if you’d like to make this chicken and rice casserole more wholesome, we’ve provided substitutions for certain ingredients below! Want to See How It’s Made? A Versatile and Appetizing Family-Favorite! My mom used to make this casserole for us when I was growing up and I still find myself craving it to this day! It’s the easiest dish to prepare and there’s always a fitting occasion. A hearty and quick dish for a sick neighbor? Check! How about a dinner party meal that can be prepared at short notice? Check! A work luncheon? Check! From pot-lucks to brunches and even average weeknights, this tantalizing chicken and rice casserole will be your new fave. What Ingredients Do I Need? Our ingredients are super simple and easily accessible: 1 (6.9 ounce) box of Chicken Rice-A-Roni 2 tablespoons of butter 1 cup of tomato juice (optional V-8) 2 cups of water 8 chicken pieces (chicken pieces of choice) 2 eggs 1 1/2 cup of flour ½ cup of vegetable or canola oil Substitutions for this Chicken and Rice Casserole From the type of rice to the tomato juice, we’ve got a bunch of substitutions for you, in case you don’t have certain ingredients on hand or just feel like making a few tweaks. As with most substitutions, remember to pay attention to the cooking time since you’re gonna need to adjust depending on the ingredients used. Rice Instead of Rice-A-Roni, you could use parboiled rice for different flavors and textures: Plain white rice with added chicken broth or bouillon for flavor. Basmati or Jasmine rice for a fragrant, tasty base. If you’re health-conscious, brown rice will do and it gives the base a nutty flavor. Butter There are a couple of choices when it comes to substituting butter, both will give you slightly different flavors: Substitute with olive oil for a dairy-free option. You can use ghee for richer flavor, extra cooking time gives ghee a nutty taste. Tomato Juice For tomato juice, you have a few options to switch it up: Chicken broth or stock for no tomato flavor. Vegetable broth works just as well. White wine combined with broth also works. If you’d prefer to stick with tomatoes, you can use diced tomatoes with the liquid. Chicken Pieces Chicken isn’t a hard and fast rule type of ingredient, there are a couple of options to get you started: Try all split chicken breasts, drumsticks, or thighs, an

items.title: Chicken and Dressing Casserole
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Casseroles » Chicken and Dressing Casserole Casseroles Chicken and Dressing Casserole No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 94 Published: October 14, 2024 Healthy homemade comfort food? Doesn't get better than that! Before you reach for a takeout menu or pull out your phone to order in, let me tell you why you should try this chicken and dressing casserole! Not only does it taste absolutely incredible. but it’s also easy to prepare, good for you, and beloved by even the pickiest eaters! Watch How It’s Made Why Should I Go for a Chicken and Dressing Casserole? We know how important it is to maintain your health, but we’re also aware how busy life can get. Sure, you can find a healthy option on just about any restaurant menu, but nothing beats the satisfaction of creating your own meals from scratch. You can make this casserole as healthy as you want, or turn it into a cheat-day dream if you feel like it! Cooking at home is more environmentally conscious than ordering in or grabbing takeout; you minimize the use of packaging and waste. As an added benefit, cooking at home also reduces the carbon emissions associated with food delivery and transportation. This chicken and dressing casserole also feeds SO many people! You could totally take it to a potluck, barbecue, or cookout, and there’ll be enough to go around. You may even end up with leftovers to enjoy the following day! With the addition of stuffing and soup, this casserole has a nostalgic taste and smell, and the crispy top layer makes it look even more amazing! Thanks to the smooth, slightly crumbly, creamy textures and mouthwatering taste of this chicken and dressing casserole you’ll never need to order in again! I’m Sold, What Do I Need? You can certainly make some substitutions for the chicken and dressing casserole, but for our core recipe, you’ll need the following ingredients: 4 split chicken breasts, or 2 whole breasts (bone-in with skin) 1 (14-ounce package) cornbread stuffing mix (Stove Top was used in this recipe) 1 (10.5-ounce) can cream of chicken soup 1 (10.5-ounce) can cream of celery soup ¼ cup butter 2 cups chicken broth (broth from cooking the chicken can be used or any other broth of choice) Substitutions for the Chicken and Dressing Casserole If you’re not feeling certain ingredients and want to swap or omit them, or you’d rather add a little something extra to the dish, you certainly can! We’ve got some substitution ideas to help you out! Chicken : If you’re a little bit pressed for time, you can use pre-cooked rotisserie chicken or leftover roasted chicken to help speed up the process. Otherwise, you can use boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs. Cornbread Stuffing Mix : If you don’t have cornbread stuffing mix on hand, you can use regular bread stuffing mix or yummy homemade bread crumbs seasoned with herbs like thyme, rosemary, and sage. You can also use cubed stale bread or cornbread as a base for t

items.title: Veggie-Packed Slow Cooker Lentil Stew
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » American » Veggie-Packed Slow Cooker Lentil Stew Recipes Veggie-Packed Slow Cooker Lentil Stew 4.50 from 8 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 34k Published: October 7, 2024 You'll love this dish that's full of protein! I’m always on the lookout for new gluten-free, vegetarian-friendly recipes. So, when I came across this veggie-packed slow cooker lentil stew, I had to try it. Stews are typically viewed as a winter food, but this recipe is so good, I could eat it any time of the year. It’s hearty and filling enough to be a winter warmer , but the vegetables keep things feeling light for those spring and summer days. It’s a unique, meatless stew that’s super filling because it’s full of plant-based protein! Lentils make a perfect meat replacement for vegetarian soups and stews. Gram for gram, they have more protein than beef, and they’re significantly less expensive, too! When cooked, they break down and create a crumbly texture (just like ground beef), which is why we use them a lot in vegetarian and vegan “meatloaf” recipes . They’re also high in fiber, so you’ll get 11 grams of protein and fiber for every serving of this tasty veggie-packed slow cooker lentil stew! Soup versus Stew At the end of the recipe, we give you the option to adjust the liquid for more or less thickness. If you follow the recipe exactly as its stated, it will turn into a very thick, hearty stew. That’s just how we like our Slow Cooker Lentil and Veggie Stew, so we think it’s perfect! But, some people prefer more or less liquid, so we want to clear one thing up. What’s the difference between a soup and a stew? Well, they’re both a combination of vegetables, fish, or meats cooked in a flavorful liquid. The major difference is that stews generally contain less liquid than soups. In a stew, the solid parts of the meal (the chunky vegetables and meats, if any) are the focus, whereas the broth is generally the focus of a soup. We consider this recipe a stew because the lentils soak up most of the liquid as they cook. That creates a thick and chunky consistency, which we find perfectly hearty and warming. Sometimes in the summertime, we like our stew thinner, though. If you tend to prefer more liquid in your soup, feel free to reduce the lentils to 3/4 cup or 1/2 cup, or add additional tomato juice or vegetable broth. Looking for other stew recipes? Check out our Slow Cooker Rosemary Lentil Stew . Or, if you love the idea of simple slow cooker dinner prep, try our Easy Tomato and Basil Slow Cooker Stew . Veggie-Packed Slow Cooker Lentil Stew This veggie-packed slow cooker lentil stew recipe is simple and inexpensive, yet it results in a large, hearty, and healthy meal. It’s an excellent choice for meatless Mondays, vegans, and meal preppers, and it’s so tasty that your whole family will love it! 4.50 from 8 votes Slow Cooker Lentil & Veggie Stew This stupendous stew is full of hearty and rich ingredients that are slow-cooked

items.title: How to Make Chicken Marinade with Common Spices
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » How to Make Chicken Marinade with Common Spices Recipes How to Make Chicken Marinade with Common Spices by Gale Compton Pin Facebook Email Shares 20 Published: September 14, 2024 Last Updated: May 13, 2025 Bland chicken? We don’t think so! Let’s get back to Flavortown to make a marinade for your chicken! Marinades are your chicken’s BFF. Without it, chicken just feels incomplete. Chicken with marinade is flavorful, tender, and juicy while chicken without marinade tends to be bland, rubbery, and hard to eat. So, why not learn how to make chicken marinade that’ll have you and your guests gunning for seconds? And the best part? All you need are some common spices that can probably already be found in your kitchen! Pictured above: Delicious Greek Chicken Kebabs How to Make a Chicken Marinade with Common Spices Before we can start making a chicken marinade, we need to choose some spices and herbs to create the perfect flavor profile. What spices will take it from “meh” to “wow”? Le­t’s talk about the best spices for marinade­s. These spices can turn plain chicke­n into a yummy dish. Think about this: a little garlic, some paprika, and a bit of cumin. It’s like a flavor party in your kitche­n! Garlic : Whether minced, powdered, or crushed, garlic adds that irresistible aroma and depth of flavor that we all know and crave. It’s also typically enjoyed by all ages, making it perfect to add to family dinner. Paprika : Not just a pretty red powder, paprika brings a smoky, slightly sweet flavor to a dish. Cumin : This earthy spice adds a warm, nutty taste that pairs perfectly with chicken. It’s like a cozy hug for your taste buds! Oregano : This herbaceous wonder adds a fresh, zesty kick to your marinade. Salt and Pepper : The dynamic duo of seasoning, salt and pepper are the unsung heroes of every kitchen. A sprinkle of salt enhances flavors, while black pepper adds a subtle heat that keeps you returning for more. Onion Powder : The silent hero of the spice rack, always there to add a subtle yet undeniable punch. Sweet and savory, onion powder adds that little something when you feel like something is missing. Tajín Seasoning : This yummy seasoning combines flavors of zesty lime, tangy chili, and a hint of salt, the perfect combination for chicken. With these basics on hand, you can whip up something magical – and your chicken and taste buds will thank you! Chicken Marinade Recipes Made with Basic Ingredients Yeah, having these ingredients on hand is one thing, but combining them is a whole different beast! No stress though, we’ve got you fam! We’ve got three basic recipes for you to dabble with to get a feel for making marinades before trying your own: Asian-Inspired Teriyaki Marinade Yummy, umami, and surprisingly easy – try this teriyaki marinade for some fire chicken! Ingredients 1/4 cup soy sauce 2 tablespoons honey 1 tablespoon rice vinegar 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 teaspoon ginger, grated 1 tablespoon sesame oil Optional: sliced gree

items.title: Oatmeal White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dessert » Oatmeal White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies Dessert Oatmeal White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 289 Published: September 5, 2024 Last Updated: May 13, 2025 Hi there, I’m Gale, and I’m excited to share with you my all-time favorite cookie recipe: Oatmeal White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies. Over the years, I’ve tried countless versions of this recipe, but I genuinely believe this one is the best I’ve ever eaten. Let me take you back about ten years. I was on a quest to create the perfect cookie for Christmas gifts. After experimenting with various combinations of ingredients, I finally hit the jackpot with this yummy recipe. The Perfect Cookie for Any Occasion The moment I baked that first batch, I gathered my family for a taste test, and the results were overwhelming. They devoured every cookie I put in front of them and asked for more! That was all the confirmation I needed. From that day forward, these cookies became my go-to Christmas gifts for neighbors and loved ones. I love how making these cookies isn’t strenuous on the wallet either—it’s an affordable treat that always impresses! What I really love about these cookies is how versatile they are. While I initially made them for holiday gifting, they quickly became a staple at gatherings throughout the year. Whether it’s a weekend brunch or a casual get-together, you can count on these cookies to steal the show. These cookies have a rich, buttery flavor that makes them absolutely mouthwatering and perfect for having with a cup of coffee. Ingredients Needed for White Chocolate Cranberry Cookies Here’s a quick rundown of the ingredients that make these cookies so special: Old-Fashioned Oats : Packed with fiber, they add a chewy texture that’s essential to oatmeal cookies. Plus, they bring a hint of heartiness that makes each bite satisfying. White Chocolate Chips : Their sweet and creamy flavor contrasts beautifully with the tartness of the cranberries, creating a delightful burst of flavors in every bite. Dried Cranberries : These little gems add a tartness that balances the sweetness of the white chocolate and the richness of the butter, giving a nice pop of flavor. Flour: Flour adds the foundation for baking cookies and the right amount of structure. Salt : The flavor is enhanced by salt and balances out the sweetness. Baking Powder: Cookies need a little lift and baking powder does the trick. Butter : The secret to their richness! Butter helps to create that melt-in-your-mouth texture we all crave in a cookie. These are a special treat, so butter up! 🙂 Brown Sugar : It adds a deeper flavor and moisture, making sure our cookies are soft and chewy. Eggs : They provide additional structure needed for the cookies while adding to that chewy texture. Vanilla Extract : A must-have for any cookie recipe, it enhances all the other flavors and gives an aromatic kick. Walnut or Pecans (optional) :

items.title: One Pot Ground Beef Stroganoff
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Diabetic-Friendly » One Pot Ground Beef Stroganoff Recipes One Pot Ground Beef Stroganoff 5 from 4 votes by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 177 Published: August 17, 2024 A healthier take on this comfort food staple. If you’ve been looking for a meal that combines the feel of a restaurant dish and the comfort of homemade cooking, you’re in the right place. Today, we’re going to dive into a classic recipe that’s both incredibly delicious and pretty darn nutritious when made with the right ingredients—one pot beef stroganoff. And the best part? You can whip it up in just 25 minutes! So let’s get cooking! What is Beef Stroganoff? Originating in Russia, beef stroganoff has been a comfort food staple in households worldwide for decades. The traditional recipe is a blend of sautéed beef strips, mushrooms, and onions in a rich, creamy sauce often spiked with a splash of brandy or wine. The dish is typically served over egg noodles, rice, or potatoes. While beef stroganoff is a delicious meal, it’s often loaded with heavy cream and butter, making it less than ideal for those looking to maintain a balanced diet. But don’t fret! We’ve revamped this beloved recipe to make it as nourishing as it is delectable. Our 25 Minute, One-Pot Stroganoff Who says you have to compromise taste for health? This version of beef stroganoff uses lean ground beef and substitutes heavy cream with a lighter alternative, Greek yogurt, to cut down on the saturated fat without sacrificing flavor. Mushrooms bring in an earthy undertone while whole wheat noodles (or cauliflower rice) serve as the perfect base. And the cherry on top? It’s a one-pot recipe! That means fewer dishes to wash and more time to savor your culinary creation. Here’s why this 25-minute, one-pot version of beef stroganoff stands out: Quick and Easy : Life’s busy, we get it! This recipe allows you to have a hearty and satisfying meal on the table in under half an hour. Nutrition-Focused : By using lean ground beef and Greek yogurt, we make this recipe more aligned with nutritional goals without compromising taste. Kid-Friendly : This recipe is a win-win for the whole family. It’s tasty enough for the kids and nutritious enough to make parents happy. Great For Meal Prep: If you’re looking for a unique meal prep recipe, try this one! It’s easily prepped and can be stored for meals all week long. What You’ll Need for this Ground Beef Stroganoff For this revamped one pot ground beef stroganoff recipe, you’ll start off with one pound of lean ground beef. You’ll also need one yellow onion and three garlic cloves, both finely chopped, to add depth and aroma. For flavor, gather a tablespoon of tomato paste, two teaspoons of smoked paprika, a teaspoon each of dried thyme and black pepper, and a half teaspoon of sea salt. To create a mouthwatering sauce that clings to every noodle, you’ll incorporate two cups of low-sodium beef broth. Speaking of noodles, make s

items.title: Homemade Chicken Gyros
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Mediterranean » Homemade Chicken Gyros Mediterranean Homemade Chicken Gyros 5 from 1 vote by Giorgio Pintzas Monzani Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 68 Published: July 13, 2024 Last Updated: May 13, 2025 Transport yourself to warm and sunny Greece without having to leave your kitchen! Adored by both locals and tourists, gyros are a Greek version of a famous dish enjoyed worldwide. It has been around for ages and comes in many different forms across regions like the Balkans, the Middle East, and Asia. Whether it’s called Kebab, Kepap, Kabab, Satè, Kebabi, or Gyros, this dish always brings joy with every mouthful. We love to try our hand at any recipe, which is how we ended up with these healthy and delicious homemade chicken gyros. Watch How They’re Made! What Are Gyros? The type of meat can vary, from chicken and pork to beef and lamb, but the cooking process stays pretty much the same. The meat is either sliced or minced, then seasoned and cooked over charcoal, on a grill, or in an oven. Typically, it’s cooked using a metal skewer, which is placed either horizontally or vertically to the heat source to cook the dish. The word gyros literally means “around”, which makes sense if you think about it! Ingredients Needed for Homemade Chicken Gyros This homemade chicken gyros recipe only requires about a dozen ingredients (most of which you probably already have in your pantry). Here’s what you’ll need: Chicken thighs Greek yogurt Salt Paprika Cumin Black pepper Dried oregano Extra virgin olive oil Apple cider vinegar Garlic Yellow onion These are the things you’ll need to make the gyro meat, but you will also want to be sure to pick up the optional extra fixins. But more on that in a bit! How to Make Gyros at Home Making these homemade chicken gyros might seem overwhelming but don’t stress! We’re going to break each step of the process down for you. First, place your chicken thighs in a large bowl and add the Greek yogurt and all of the spices. Mix well until the meat is evenly coated. Next, add the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, and the two cloves of crushed garlic. Mix well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 12 hours. You can do this in the morning before you head to work or the night before you plan on making this for dinner (it can marinate in the fridge safely for up to 24 hours). When you are ready to cook the gyros, move the oven shelf to the lowest setting and preheat to 350° F. Then, line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut the onion in half, remove the skin, and place it on the baking sheet with the flat side down. Poke the 3 bamboo sticks into the onion, forming a triangle shape, to create the base where you will skewer the pieces of meat. The triangle should span most of the width of the onion. Begin creating your gyros by threading each chicken thigh so that they all fit together perfectly. Be sure not to press them too tightly together. They should be lightly resting on top of each other. Keep

items.title: How to Make Crispy Fried Chicken at Home
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » How to Make Crispy Fried Chicken at Home Recipes How to Make Crispy Fried Chicken at Home No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 37 Published: June 29, 2024 Last Updated: September 19, 2024 Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, and delicious all over! Since you’re here, it’s safe to assume that you’re interested in learning how to make crispy fried chicken at home. Homemade meals are making a comeback, not just because they tend to be better for you, but also because they can help you save money! Preparing fried chicken at home gives you the opportunity to control the types and amounts of ingredients being used in your meal. This chicken recipe is not only bursting with classic down home flavors, but it’s also incredibly simple to make. With a few basic ingredients and about 30 minutes, you and your guests will get to enjoy the most juicy, white tender meat inside a golden brown crispy coating. This recipe was created by my mom over 50 years ago. It’s the go-to recipe everyone in our family continues to make and love. It’s a timeless recipe and a culinary treasure. Watch How It’s Made! Ingredients Needed to Make Crispy Fried Chicken Making the most delicious crispy fried chicken at home is actually very simple! But before we get to the process, here’s what you will need in terms of ingredients: 1 full chicken with the skin on 3 whole eggs 1 cup of buttermilk or whole milk 2 ½ cups of all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon of paprika (optional) 2 cups vegetable or canola oil for frying (Crisco would also work) Additional Ingredients for Your Crispy Fried Chicken We’ve kept the ingredients for this recipe very simple, and you can be sure that it will taste amazing as is. That said, we always want you to feel free to put your own spin on things! Here are some additional ingredients you can add to your crispy fried chicken recipe: Herbs : Adding herbs like oregano or thyme can add a unique and yummy flavor to your fried chicken. Spices : Adding garlic powder, onion powder, and even cayenne pepper adds a savory and/or spicy kick to your crispy chicken! Hot sauce : Adding hot sauce to your batter will turn up the heat of your chicken (especially when combined with cayenne!) How to Make Crispy Fried Chicken Now that we have our ingredients sorted, we can get to the fun part! Let’s make some crispy fried chicken! Step 1 In a mixing bowl, add the eggs and buttermilk. Note: If you’re going to add hot sauce, now would be the time to do so! Use a fork or whisk to whip the mixture until combined. Add all the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss them to coat completely. Then, cover and refrigerate the chicken for 2 to 4 hours. Skip refrigeration if you’re short on time! Step 2 In a gallon-size Ziplock bag, add the flour, salt, black pepper, and paprika. Shake to combine. Add a few pieces of chicken at a time and shake to coat. Place the coated pieces on a plate. Once all the pieces are covered, return them to the b

items.title: 5-Ingredient Broccoli Bacon Salad
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Salads » 5-Ingredient Broccoli Bacon Salad Salads 5-Ingredient Broccoli Bacon Salad No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 64 Published: June 22, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 The perfect combination of flavors, textures, and nutrients! In the world of salads, the broccoli bacon salad holds a special place. It’s a delightful mix of textures and flavors, combining the crunchiness of fresh broccoli with the smoky savoriness of bacon. And the best part? You only need five simple ingredients to make it! This 5-ingredient broccoli bacon salad is perfect for those who love to whip up something quick yet impressive, be it for a family dinner, a potluck, or a picnic. Prefer to Watch Instead of Read? Ingredients in this Salad This salad is a harmonious blend of five key ingredients, each bringing its unique taste and nutritional benefits to the table. Bacon The star of the dish, bacon, adds a rich, smoky flavor that complements the freshness of the broccoli. Its crispy texture contrasts beautifully with the other components, making it a non-negotiable ingredient in this recipe (unless you’re trying to make it vegetarian!) Broccoli Broccoli is not just a nutritional powerhouse, packed with vitamins, minerals, and fiber; it’s also the perfect canvas for the other flavors in this salad. Its crisp, slightly earthy taste balances out the richness of the bacon. Apple Adding a sweet and tart dimension, apples bring a delightful juiciness to the mix. They pair wonderfully with the savory bacon and add a fresh crunch that elevates the salad. Mayonnaise Mayonnaise acts as the creamy base for the salad dressing, binding all the ingredients together. Its silky texture and mild flavor make it the ideal backdrop for the stronger flavors of bacon and apple cider vinegar. Apple Cider Vinegar A dash of apple cider vinegar cuts through the richness of the mayonnaise and bacon, adding a bright, tangy note that brings the salad to life. It also helps in balancing the overall flavor profile. What to Pair with This Broccoli Salad This versatile broccoli bacon salad pairs beautifully with a range of dishes. See some of our favorites: Slow Cooker Barbecue Pulled Chicken : Enjoy the tender and flavorful slow cooker barbecue pulled chicken, which effortlessly complements the crunchy freshness of the broccoli salad with its rich and smoky barbecue goodness. One of these 10 Healthy Sandwiches : Choose from an array of 10 healthy sandwiches, each offering a nutritious and delightful pairing option for the broccoli salad, perfect for a well-rounded meal. Slow Cooker Savory Superfood Soup : Dive into the comforting warmth of this slow cooker savory superfood soup, a nutrient-packed companion to the broccoli salad, ideal for chilly days. Easy Baby Back Ribs : Indulge in these easy baby back ribs, where the meat falls off the bone, offering a decadent and savory counterpoint to the light and crisp broccoli salad. Savory Lemon

items.title: Peanut Butter Banana Cups
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Peanut Butter Banana Cups Recipes Peanut Butter Banana Cups 4.61 from 58 votes by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 120k Published: June 18, 2024 Indulge in plant-based candy without the guilt! What time is it when you normally feel the rumbling of a craving? Does it strike after dinner when you’re sitting on the couch, and you’ve just realized that there’s nothing sweet in the house? Many after-hours ice cream runs have started this way! Does your craving hit you mid-afternoon, in your office, and leave you in search of the nearest vending machine or bakery? If you’re committed to healthy, clean eating, you know that giving in to cravings for refined, processed, sugary sweets can be damaging to your eating plan and your health! But you don’t need to swear off sweets completely! We like to stock up on healthy alternatives to our favorite sweets, like these peanut butter and banana Reese’s cup alternatives. That way, we’ll always have a healthy treat on hand when cravings strike! Peanut Butter Banana Cup Recipe Enter our scrumptious peanut butter and banana Reese’s cup alternatives, rich, chocolatey, peanut buttery cups that melt in your mouth but are made with 100% clean eating ingredients. Each bite contains nothing but dark chocolate, which is lower in sugar than milk chocolate and rich in flavonoids, peanut butter for protein, banana for a heaping dose of antioxidants, and coconut oil, one of our favorite healthy substitutes for butter. Simply spoon your melted chocolate into the bottom of your baking cups and top with a slice of banana and a scoop of peanut butter mixed with coconut oil. Then, top each nugget with a dollop of chocolate. Freeze the cups for twenty minutes, and enjoy. Having these delicious cups in your kitchen will give you that candy feel and flavor without the added fat and calories. Homemade, clean-eating candy for the win! Want More Peanut Butter + Banana? If you love Reese’s Peanut Butter Cups, you’re sure to love this peanut butter and banana Reese’s cup recipe even more . Our creamy banana-filled center gives the peanut butter cups that extra yum factor. And they are melt-in-your-mouth amazing! If you enjoy them, you might also like to try: 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cups Chocolate Covered Peanut Butter Banana Pops Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie 4.61 from 58 votes Peanut Butter Banana Cups A creamy banana filled center will have your taste buds wanting more and more. items.title: Sheet Pan Chili Lime Salmon
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Low-Carb » Sheet Pan Chili Lime Salmon Low-Carb Sheet Pan Chili Lime Salmon 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 218 Published: June 1, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 The perfect blend of bold flavors and nutritional goodness. Welcome to the flavorful world of sheet pan chili lime salmon, a dish that joins the zesty tang of lime with the rich warmth of chili. This recipe turns a simple salmon filet into the perfect blend of bold flavors and nutritional goodness. It’s also surprisingly easy to prepare – even for beginner cooks! This salmon is ideal for busy weeknights yet sophisticated enough for a weekend dinner party. Packed with the health benefits of omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidant-rich spices, our chili lime salmon is not just a treat for your taste buds but also wonderful for your body and brain. See How It’s Made Ingredients Overview This chili lime baked salmon recipe calls for a harmonious blend of fresh, healthy ingredients and rich, aromatic spices. Each component plays a vital role in creating the dish’s unique flavor (and nutrition) profile: Salmon Salmon is the star of this dish, renowned not only for its tender, flaky texture but also for its impressive nutritional profile, including a high content of omega-3 fatty acids, protein, and B vitamins. Opt for fresh, sustainably-sourced salmon for the best flavor and health benefits. Lime The lime juice adds a bright, citrusy zing that cuts through the richness of the salmon, infusing the dish with a refreshing tanginess. Lime juice also contributes vitamin C and antioxidants. Olive Oil Extra virgin olive oil is used in this salmon recipe for its quality and flavor. It serves as a healthy fat base for the marinade, helping to coat the salmon evenly and enhance the absorption of the spices. Olive oil is also beneficial for heart health. Chili Powder Chili powder gives this dish its warmth and depth. This spice comes in varying heat levels, so you can choose one that suits your spice preference. Garlic Powder Garlic powder offers an earthy flavor that complements the chili and lime beautifully. It’s a convenient way to add a garlicky punch without the hassle of peeling and mincing fresh garlic. That said, feel free to use minced garlic instead (or also!) Onion Powder Onion powder adds a subtle sweetness, rounding out the spice profile of our chili lime salmon. It melds well with the other flavors, enhancing the overall savory notes. Salt Salt is essential for bringing out the natural flavors of the salmon and the spices. It should be used in moderation to balance the dish without overpowering it. Black Pepper A hint of black pepper introduces a slight kick and complexity to this sheet pan salmon. Freshly ground black pepper works best for its potent flavor. items.title: Gluten-Free Living: Delicious and Nourishing Recipes without Gluten
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Gluten-Free » Gluten-Free Living: Delicious and Nourishing Recipes without Gluten Gluten-Free Gluten-Free Living: Delicious and Nourishing Recipes without Gluten by SkinnyMs. Pin Facebook Email Shares 40 Published: May 25, 2024 Recipes that are free of gluten but bursting with flavor! Maintaining a gluten-free lifestyle doesn’t mean you have to sacrifice flavor. In fact, it opens up a world of possibilities that celebrate wholesome and delicious ingredients. The collection of gluten-free recipes below is the perfect guide to gluten-free living, offering not only practical insights into a gluten-free diet but also a variety of tasty and nourishing meals. Table of Contents Understanding Gluten and Gluten-Free Living The Gluten-Free Pantry Gluten-Free Flours Ancient Grains Breakfast Bliss – Gluten-Free Starters Protein Blueberry Quinoa Breakfast Bowl Gluten-Free Kale Frittata Lunch and Dinner Delights Zucchini Noodles with Pesto Chilled Salmon Quinoa Salad Slow Cooker Italian Chicken and Sweet Potatoes Gluten-Free Chicken Scampi Sweet Endings – Gluten-Free Desserts 5-Minute Peanut Butter Fudge Easy Tofu Chocolate Mousse Understanding Gluten and Gluten-Free Living To navigate the world of gluten-free living, it’s essential to understand what gluten is and where it lurks. Gluten is a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. It can trigger adverse reactions in individuals with gluten sensitivity or celiac disease. Embracing a gluten-free lifestyle involves learning to identify gluten sources and discovering alternative grains and ingredients that form the foundation of gluten-free recipes. It’s also important to read labels and ask questions before purchasing any food products. Cooking from scratch is always a better option, as you can control the ingredients used (gluten is sneaky and there can still be traces of it even if you eat a gluten-free dish at a restaurant). The Gluten-Free Pantry Once you make the decision to go gluten-free, making sure you have all of the gluten-free ingredients you’ll need is the next step! Let’s take a look at some of these essentials. Gluten-Free Flours Building a gluten-free pantry starts with the right flour. Almond flour, coconut flour, rice flour, and quinoa flour are versatile alternatives that lend unique flavors and textures to your dishes. Experimenting with these flours opens up a world of baking possibilities. Oats are another great option for gluten-free baking. Oats can be ground into flour or used as a whole grain for baking and breakfast dishes. Bean flours are also widely available and can be used to create a variety of gluten-free baked goods. Ancient Grains Quinoa, millet, and buckwheat are nutrient-rich ancient grains that serve as fantastic substitutes for traditional gluten-containing grains. Their nutty flavors and varied textures make them ideal for salads, pilafs, and even breakfast bowls. These grains are also gluten-free and high in fiber, making them a perfect choic

items.title: Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Pasta Dishes » Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta Pasta Dishes Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 92 Published: May 18, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 Tantalize your tastebuds and satisfy your hunger with this healthy cajun dish. Dive into the tasty world of cajun cuisine with our spicy cajun shrimp pasta – a dish that promises to tantalize your taste buds with its bold and fiery flavors. This recipe combines large, juicy shrimp seasoned with the unmistakable zest of Cajun spices, perfectly cooked whole wheat pasta, and a rich cream sauce, creating a symphony of flavors in every bite. Table of Contents Watch Instead of Read! Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta Ingredients Whole Wheat Pasta Shrimp Cajun Seasoning Garlic Powder Olive Oil Fresh Garlic Heavy Cream Cherry Tomatoes Step-by-Step Instruction Customize This Spicy Cajun Pasta Vary the Protein Add Vegetables Change Up the Pasta Adjust the Creaminess Spice Level Garnishing Options Gluten-Free and Low-Carb Options FAQ for Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta Ideal for those who love a bit of heat in their meals, this cajun shrimp pasta recipe is a delight for the taste buds and a visually appealing meal that’s perfect for both weeknight dinners and special occasions. The balance of spicy, savory, and creamy elements makes it a crowd-pleaser, while its straightforward preparation ensures you can easily bring this dish to your table. Watch Instead of Read! Spicy Cajun Shrimp Pasta Ingredients Whole Wheat Pasta Whole wheat pasta is a healthier alternative to regular pasta, offering a richer fiber content and a nuttier flavor. For cooking, be sure to use plenty of water and stir occasionally to prevent sticking. If whole wheat pasta isn’t your preference, feel free to substitute with any pasta variety you like, such as white pasta, gluten-free options, or even spiraled vegetables for a low-carb version. Shrimp Shrimp brings a sweet, seafood richness to the dish and is a great source of lean protein. When cooking shrimp, remember they cook quickly; they’re done as soon as they turn pink and opaque. Frozen shrimp can work as a convenient alternative. If you’re not a fan of shrimp, chicken or tofu can be great substitutes in this spicy cajun pasta. Cajun Seasoning Cajun seasoning is the heart of this dish, offering a blend of spicy, garlicky, and herby flavors. Be mindful of the salt content in store-bought Cajun seasonings; you may want to adjust additional salt in the recipe accordingly. If you don’t have Cajun seasoning, you can mix paprika, garlic powder, a bit of cayenne, oregano, thyme, and black pepper to create a homemade version. Garlic Powder Garlic powder adds a subtle, earthy flavor. It’s less intense than fresh garlic but equally aromatic. You can substitute with an equal amount of fresh minced garlic if preferred; just sauté it until fragrant before adding other ingredients. Olive Oil Olive oil is used for sautéing and

items.title: Roasted Tuscan Vegetables
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Sides » Roasted Tuscan Vegetables Sides Roasted Tuscan Vegetables No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 471 Published: April 13, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 Savor the flavor of these tender, roasted veggies! Looking for a delicious, healthy, and easy-to-make side dish? Try these roasted Tuscan vegetables! These savory, flavorful roasted vegetables will be the star of your dinner. Packed with Italian flavors and healthy, nutrient-packed veggies, they make the perfect side for many dishes. Plus, they’re ready in just 30 minutes or less. So go ahead and give them a try tonight! Watch How They’re Made! Nutrient-Packed Veggies One of the best things about our roasted Tuscan vegetables is that they’re packed with nutrients. From onions and bell peppers to asparagus, artichoke hearts, and even tomatoes, there’s something for everyone in this dish. These nutritious ingredients are great sources of things like vitamin C, Vitamin K, folate, and fiber (all of which are essential for a healthy body and mind!) And because they’re all roasted together on one pan, you’ll get all of the flavors without any extra stress. Colorful Tuscan Side Dish In A Pinch Not only are roasted Tuscan vegetables healthy and flavorful, but they’re also incredibly easy to make. In just 30 minutes or less, you’ll have a delicious and colorful one-pan side dish that’s sure to impress your family and friends. So next time you’re looking for a quick and easy side dish that will liven up any plate, look no further than roasted Tuscan vegetables. Need some main course inspiration to serve these yummy roasted veggies with? We’ve got you covered: Mediterranean Salmon Burger Mediterranean Style Greek Meatballs Healthy Chicken Parmesan Balsamic Chicken Crockpot Recipe Easy Pesto Salmon Recipe Vegetable Prep Tips Sometimes, prepping veggies can seem like a huge time waster. Well, there are a few ways to skip that part. One way is to buy them pre-cut at the grocery store. This will obviously save you some time, but it will also likely cost a bit more. If you want to prepare them yourself, there are a few shortcuts that can help. For example, rather than peeling and dicing each onion by hand, try using a food processor. This will save you a ton of time in the long run.I also recommend setting some time aside to prep all of your veggies at the start of the week, so that by the time you get back from work on a busy school night your veggies are all ready to go! How To Make These Roasted Tuscan Veggies Once you’ve got your veggies washed, prepped, and ready, making these roasted Tuscan vegetables is a breeze. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Then, simply toss all of your ingredients onto a baking sheet, spread them into a single layer, and roast for 25 to 30 minutes. Once they’re golden and tender, they’re ready to enjoy! items.title: 30-Minute Meals | 21 Easy Dinner Recipes
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dinner » 30-Minute Meals | 21 Easy Dinner Recipes Dinner 30-Minute Meals | 21 Easy Dinner Recipes by Gale Compton Pin Facebook Email Shares 100 Published: April 10, 2024 Last Updated: April 18, 2024 Pick and choose from our list of 30-minute meals that make weeknights a breeze! When life gets busy, the last thing you want to do is spend hours in the kitchen. Whether you’ve been chasing after the kids all day, grinding away at the office, or in class from morning to night, a quick meal sounds like a dream. Thanks to these 30-minute meals, you can skip the fast food and prioritize your health. Not only are they easy and stress-free, but also some of the yummiest healthy recipes you’ll ever try! 30-Minute Meals for Easy Weeknights Welcome to our collection of quick and easy dinner ideas, perfect for busy weeknights. With our 30-minute meals list, you can wave goodbye to the stress of lengthy meal prep and hello to satisfying dishes that are just as flavorful as they are simple. Whether you’re an experienced cook looking to streamline your weekday dinners or a beginner in the kitchen seeking foolproof recipes, we’ve got you covered with various options to suit different tastes and dietary needs. Craving tasty food? These­ meals are super e­asy thanks to the everyday ingredients and simple instructions. Plus, they come together quickly to create yummy burgers, zesty tacos, and more! And they’re so much better for you than fast food and takeout! 1. Broccoli and Mushroom Stir-Fry Super easy and even more satisfying, this broccoli and mushroom stir-fry requires only a handful of ingredients and literally takes 10 minutes to prepare. Mushrooms and cashews help make this would-be side dish more filling (although you could make more and devour that — we won’t judge). Try it out here: Broccoli Mushroom Stir-Fry 2. Easy Salmon Pesto Would you believe us if we told you this recipe only has 2 (that’s right 2!) ingredients? Well neither could we, but it’s true! Nutritious and wholesome, this meal only takes 5 minutes to prepare, and if you feel it’s lacking a little in the herbs and spice department, you could totally make it your own! Try it out here: Easy Pesto Salmon Recipe 3. Grilled Shrimp Tacos Tacos and seafood are a match made in heaven! Just try this quick and easy party in your mouth and you’ll see. Hearty shrimp and a variety of accompaniments such as black beans, lettuce, tomato, red onion, jalapeno, and avocado make this a standout meal that you’ll want to have every week(or night!) Try it out here: Grilled Shrimp Tacos 4. Crispy Air Fryer Chicken Wings By now everyone and their mom should have an air-fryer. It’s lightweight, easy to use, and makes cooking a breeze. So give this healthy chicken wing recipe a try for a treat-worthy dinner or a chill date night. Try it out here: Crispy Air Fryer Chicken Wings 5. Amazing Black Beanadillas These flavor-packed vegetarian quesadillas are not only out-of-this-world delicious bu

items.title: How to Make a Waffle Charcuterie Board
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Breakfast » How to Make a Waffle Charcuterie Board Breakfast How to Make a Waffle Charcuterie Board 5 from 2 votes by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 108 Published: March 23, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 Breakfast (or brunch) has never been so beautiful and delicious! Put a delightful twist on breakfast (or brunch) with our waffle charcuterie board! This innovative take blends a classic charcuterie’s fun and friendly nature with the comforting appeal of a warm, sweet breakfast. It’s an inviting way to gather friends and family around the table for a shared meal that’s not only delicious but also a feast for the eyes. Perfect for lazy weekend brunches, special occasions, or when you want to make breakfast an extraordinary affair, this waffle board will transform your morning routine into a delicious adventure. What is a Charcuterie Board? Traditionally, a charcuterie board is an assortment of meats, cheeses, artisan breads, olives, fruit, and nuts, artistically arranged on a serving board. It’s not just about the food but the presentation and the shared grazing experience over the board. This French culinary tradition has evolved and now includes various interpretations, like our waffle-themed charcuterie board. Our Sweet Breakfast Twist Instead of the usual meats and cheeses, our waffle charcuterie board is a playful and sweet take on this classic. We’re using protein-rich waffles and various sweet and savory toppings as the foundation. This board combines the coziness of a warm breakfast with the interactive, communal nature of a classic charcuterie board, making it a unique and enjoyable way to start the day. Best Ways to Serve A Waffle Board A waffle charcuterie board is best served fresh and warm. You can cook the waffles just before serving or keep them warm in the oven until it’s time to eat. Here’s the basics: Use a large wooden board or platter as your base, and place a small bowl of the peanut butter and honey mixture where you’d like it (If you plan on using other bowls for different ingredients, now would be the time to add those too.) Then, arrange the waffle pieces in sections around the bowl(s), leaving space for the fruit, cheese, and other toppings. Most importantly, have fun with it! Creative Presentation Ideas for Your Waffle Board A waffle charcuterie board is not just about the delicious combination of flavors; it’s also a visual treat. The way you present your board can significantly enhance the overall experience. Here are some creative ideas to make your waffle board truly stand out. Choosing the Right Board Start by selecting the perfect board. Wooden charcuterie boards offer a rustic, cozy feel, while a slate or marble board can give a more elegant touch. The size of your board will depend on the number of guests; a larger board is necessary for a party, while a smaller one is perfect for intimate gatherings. Creative Arrangement Begin by placing your bowl of

items.title: The Best Clean-Eating Carrot Cake
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dessert » The Best Clean-Eating Carrot Cake Dessert The Best Clean-Eating Carrot Cake 5 from 1 vote by Kelsey Butler, MS, RDN Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 301 Published: March 16, 2024 Last Updated: July 3, 2024 Satisfy your sweet tooth with this moist and healthy cake! Whether you are working towards a clean eating overhaul in your daily meal plan or are just wanting to take advantage of the many benefits of clean eating , this clean-eating carrot cake recipe is the perfect fit! Many people have a tendency to overcomplicate clean eating. At its core, it is truly very simple. Clean ingredients (or whole, minimally processed foods) produce meals that help your body function efficiently without you having to survive on bland recipes. Eating clean doesn’t have to be boring, it just takes a little bit of time to get into the habit of choosing clean recipes. Our best clean-eating carrot cake will make a great starting point! Prefer to Watch Instead of Read? What Makes This the Best Clean Eating Carrot Cake? So what makes this the best clean-eating carrot cake there ever was? Is it the abundance of taste and flavor from the natural maple syrup, hearty walnuts, or fragrant ground cinnamon? Could it be the perfect texture that makes you forget that it came from natural products and not some random box from the store? Or maybe it’s the health benefits you get after consuming the grated carrots or the boost of energy from the protein in the Greek yogurt that really puts it over the top? No matter what makes it the best for you, just follow the instructions, and you can reap all of the benefits this clean-eating carrot cake has to offer. Gathering Up Your Ingredients Paying attention to this step is one of the first steps in understanding clean eating. For many of us, we only think of vegetables and other ingredients as a side or thrown into a casserole. When you are working on switching to a clean-eating lifestyle, you will learn to see them as powerhouses for a variety of recipes and really broaden the options you have when creating weekly meal plans. For this particular clean-eating carrot cake recipe, you will need the following ingredients: Eggs White whole wheat flour Baking soda Salt Ground cinnamon Maple syrup (could also use honey or agave, depending on what you have on hand) Grated carrots (If looking for inspiration on how to add these to your meals, check out a few other delicious ways to prepare carrots ) Walnuts Raisins Greek yogurt Lemon Applesauce If you wanted to add a bit more punch to it, you could also add some nutmeg or other spices to your liking. This would be the perfect option for any upcoming holiday potluck to make sure that at least something that you can consume is packed full of natural ingredients. It could also help introduce clean-eating to friends and family by showing them that just because something is healthy doesn’t mean that it has to taste bland. Our Most Popular Family Clean E

I love Sunday suppers with family and friends. Spending a slow, lazy Sunday (or Saturday, or any day, for that matter!) visiting with loved ones brings me joy. The phrase “Sunday Supper” brings with it images of good company, good conversation, and good food. Is there anything better? The term also implies hours of preparation and work in the kitchen. When I think of a hearty pasta sauce, I envision slow cooking a simmering sauce all day. It doesn’t have to be that way! You can make a praise-worthy, meaty, satisfying sauce without the lengthy time investment. I won’t tell anyone. It will be our little secret! Table of Contents What’s a Ragout? Is it Healthy? Storage and Leftovers Reheating What Do I Need for the Easy Sunday Supper Ragout? A Range of Yummy Bases to Choose From Step-by-Step Sunday Supper Beef and Turkey Sausage Ragout Frequently Asked Questions What’s a Ragout? What exactly is a ragout, you might ask? Ragout is a term borrowed from French cuisine and refers to a slow-cooked meat-based sauce. Traditionally, a ragout would require hours of simmering to develop the flavors and tenderize the meat. But with our easy Sunday supper ragout recipe, you can achieve the same mouthwatering results in a fraction of the time. Is it Healthy? Sure! This easy Sunday supper ragout is packed with nutritious value and offer so many benefits on top of being a delicious, hearty meal: Protein Power : The stewing beef, pork, or lamb in ragout provides essential protein, helping your body build and repair tissues, and keeping you full for longer. Vitamin Boost : Carrots and celery contribute vitamins like A and K, promoting good vision, skin health, and blood clotting. Heart-Healthy Tomatoes : The diced tomatoes are rich in antioxidants, like lycopene, which may support heart health. Bone Building : The dish’s long-simmered broth contains minerals like calcium and magnesium, crucial for maintaining strong bones. Low in Processed Ingredients : Making ragout at home allows you to control the ingredients, reducing the intake of processed additives and preservatives often found in ready-made meals. Fiber from Veggies : The vegetables add dietary fiber, aiding digestion and promoting a healthy gut. Hydration from Broth : The broth keeps you hydrated, and its warmth can be soothing, especially on a cozy Sunday evening. Red Wine Benefits : The red wine, in moderation, may have cardiovascular benefits due to its antioxidants. Herb and Spice Goodness : Thyme not only adds flavor but may also have antimicrobial properties, contributing to overall wellness. Versatile Nutrition : You can pair ragout with various bases like pasta, polenta, or potatoes, providing flexibility in meeting you

items.title: Quick and Easy Chicken Enchilada Soup
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Dish Type » Soup, Stew, & Chili » Quick and Easy Chicken Enchilada Soup Soup, Stew, & Chili Quick and Easy Chicken Enchilada Soup 4 from 1 vote by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 111 Published: March 1, 2024 Last Updated: June 7, 2024 An accidental creation bound to keep you warm and snug all week! Every recipe has its humble beginnings, and this quick and easy chicken enchilada soup is no exception. This fantastic recipe was born out of necessity during a kitchen experiment gone right. Picture this: a batch of chicken enchiladas in progress, a shortage of tortillas, and a surplus of filling. The solution? Transform it into a rich and satisfying soup that retains all the flavors of classic enchiladas but with a comforting, slurp-worthy twist. Table of Contents The Accidental Creation of this Chicken Enchilada Soup Variations to Spice Things Up Tips for the Perfect Chicken Enchilada Soup Presentation of this Chicken Enchilada Soup What You Will Need How to Make this Delicious Quick and Easy Chicken Enchilada Soup Commonly Asked Questions More Enchilada Recipes The Accidental Creation of this Chicken Enchilada Soup As with many great recipes, our chicken enchilada soup was a happy accident. The humble origins of this dish occurred when I found myself with extra enchilada filling and no tortillas in sight. Instead of fretting, I decided to get creative. Initially, I turned the surplus into a dip, perfect for serving with crispy chips. It was a hit, but my culinary journey didn’t stop there. The thought struck me – why not turn this into a soup? Thus, the quick and easy chicken enchilada soup was born. Variations to Spice Things Up Shrimp Enchilada Soup: Take a seafood spin on this classic by substituting shrimp for chicken. The delicate sweetness of shrimp pairs wonderfully with the bold flavors of the enchilada filling. Veggie Enchilada Soup: Try a vegetarian option by omitting the chicken and loading the soup with diced zucchini, nutrient-rich spinach, hearty black beans, and succulent sweet corn. This variation is a perfect mix of vibrant veggies and wholesome goodness. Shredded Pork Fiesta: For a meatier option, switch out the chicken for succulent shreds of pork. The slow-cooked tenderness of shredded pork adds a savory depth to the soup. Leftover Turkey: Extend the holiday spirit by repurposing leftover turkey into a soul-warming enchilada soup. The richness of the turkey pairs exceptionally well with the enchilada flavors. Such a great way to use leftover turkey from the holidays! Tofu: For a vegan substitute, choose firm tofu for a meaty texture. Cut them into bite-sized cubes (or get some already cubed tofu from your local grocery). Be sure to press the tofu to drain excess water so they can absorb the soups flavors well! Tips for the Perfect Chicken Enchilada Soup Using a homemade chicken broth: Elevate the soup by using homemade chicken broth. The depth of flavor will be worth the extra effort. Adjust

items.title: Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Cuisine » Mediterranean » Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas Mediterranean Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas No ratings yet by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 97 Published: February 17, 2024 A hearty plant-based dish with warm earthy spices and just the right amount of heat. Chickpeas are one of those legumes that are filling, satisfying, and with the right spices, bring a feeling of warmth and comfort. They’re full of protein and fiber, and make a great meat substitute. This spicy Mediterranean chickpeas recipe will hit the spot and appease even the pickiest of eaters! Chickpeas, also known as garbanzo beans, are a staple in Mediterranean cuisine. They are an excellent source of plant-based protein, fiber, and essential vitamins and minerals. A single cup of cooked chickpeas contains approximately 15 grams of protein, making them a great option for vegetarians and vegans. Additionally, chickpeas are rich in folate, iron, magnesium, and potassium, which are essential for maintaining a healthy body. As an added bonus, they are loaded with fiber, making them a low glycemic choice to help reduce spikes in blood sugar. Table of Contents Versatility in Mediterranean Cuisine Health Benefits of Mediterranean Chickpeas Incorporating Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas into Your Diet What Will I Need? Let’s Get Started! Proper Storage and Reheating Some Great Additions to Your Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas Frequently Asked Questions Versatility in Mediterranean Cuisine One of the key reasons why chickpeas are so popular in Mediterranean cuisine is their versatility. They can be used in a variety of dishes, from salads and soups to stews and spreads. For example, hummus, a creamy dip made from chickpeas, is a staple in Mediterranean cuisine. It can be enjoyed as a dip with pita bread or used as a spread in sandwiches and wraps. Chickpeas can also be roasted and seasoned with spices to create a crunchy and flavorful snack – making them excellent for keeping the pounds off. Health Benefits of Mediterranean Chickpeas Chickpeas are a fantastic source of protein and fiber, making them an ideal choice for both vegetarians and those looking to incorporate more plant-based meals into their diet. By substituting meat with chickpeas, you not only reduce your consumption of saturated fats but also increase your intake of essential nutrients. The combination of protein and fiber helps to keep you feeling fuller for longer, making these spicy Mediterranean chickpeas a delicious and satiating option for any meal. Incorporating Spicy Mediterranean Chickpeas into Your Diet Now that you know the benefits of spicy Mediterranean chickpeas, it’s time to incorporate them into your diet. Start by experimenting with different spice combinations to find your preferred level of heat. You can also try adding chickpeas to your favorite Mediterranean dishes, such as Greek salads or vegetable stews. For a quick and easy meal, toss spicy chickpeas with roasted ve

items.title: Easy Vegetable Ragu
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Meal Type » Dinner » Easy Vegetable Ragu Recipes Easy Vegetable Ragu No ratings yet by Gale Compton Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 694 Published: February 13, 2024 Last Updated: May 9, 2024 Satisfy your cravings for Italian comfort food with this vegetarian-friendly dish! While ragu sauce is typically meat-based, this recipe was created to be 100% vegetarian-friendly! But don’t worry, it tastes just as delicious as a meat-based ragu. And better yet? This easy vegetable ragu recipe also takes less than an hour to prepare and can serve up to 5 people. A delicious and nutritious meal that the entire family can enjoy—what more could you ask for? Get Your Veggies Ready Ahead of Time Preparing all of your ingredients ahead of time will make the cooking process for this easy vegetable ragu go as smoothly as possible. You can start the process by prepping your veggies. Finely chop your celery and carrot, and dice up your cremini mushrooms and bell pepper. Keep the cutting board out so that you can mince your garlic and chop up some fresh sage. Finally, make sure your tomatoes are clean and ready for later! Cooking Your Vegetable Ragu For the cooking process, you are going to want a heavy pot that you will heat over a medium-high flame. Heat the butter and olive oil first and then add your celery, carrots, and garlic cloves. Saute these veggies for about three minutes. Add the tomatoes, bell pepper, mushrooms, and tomato paste to the pot and let that cook for a couple minutes. Afterwards, add your Italian seasoning blend and your fresh sage and sauté the mixture for a couple more minutes. Grab your vegetable stock and pour it into the pot. If you do not have vegetable stock, you can use water, but the stock will add some flavor! Bring the ingredients in the pot to a boil and then bring it down to low heat, letting it simmer for about 30 minutes so the liquid can be absorbed. As your vegetable ragu simmers in the pot, you can cook your whole wheat pasta following the packet instructions. Make sure you save about half a cup of pasta water. Once the whole wheat pasta and vegetable ragu are done, add the pasta into the pot with the ragu, along with half a cup of saved pasta water. To make sure it’s all mixed together, toss your pasta around to coat it with the ragu. Finally, add some salt and pepper to season it and some chili flakes if you like it spicier! Want to Serve this Easy Vegetable Ragu as a Side Dish? While this Italian-inspired pasta is a great and comforting meal all on it’s own, you can choose to serve it as a side dish if you wish! Here are some main course options that we’d recommend trying out: Classic Italian Meatballs “Melt in Your Mouth” Italian Baked Chicken One-Pan Rustic-Style Italian Chicken Italian Sausage and Tomato Pie Italian Turkey Sausage Whether you enjoy this easy vegetable ragu as a main course, or serve it as part of a Sunday evening Italian feast, be sure to let us know what you think of it in the c

items.title: Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Diet Type » Plant-Based » Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca Plant-Based Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca 3.88 from 16 votes by Chef Sallie Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 634 Published: February 8, 2024 Cut the carbs with this decadent pasta made entirely from veggies! Transport your taste buds to Naples, Italy with this gorgeous Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca recipe. It’s guaranteed to WOW the whole family. When struck with those powerful carb cravings, this Spaghetti Squash Puttensca makes the perfect, skinny solution! The dish presents itself as an indulgent bowl of pasta, when it’s actually made entirely of vegetables. With creamy, decadent textures and ultra-satisfying flavors, this “pasta” dish will most certainly satisfy. Not to mention, your waistline will appreciate it as well. Cut the Carbs with this Italian-Inspired Dish Here at Skinny Ms., we love recipes that sub in spaghetti squash for actual pasta. The nutrient-rich veggie forms a bunch of amazingly cool strands that resemble spaghetti, without the heaviness of actual pasta. Meanwhile, it serves as a low-carb, low-fat, and grain-free alternative that shaves off a boatload of calories. “Puttanesca” refers to a bold, flavorful pasta sauce used in Italian-inspired dishes. It usually involves tomatoes, garlic, and sometimes even anchovies. Our yummy version uses a handful of vibrant, nutritious veggies like zucchini squash, sweet onion, bell peppers, broccoli, and grape tomatoes. Eye-Catching and Nutrient-Dense Roasted to tender-crisp perfection, these vegetables lend incredible color and depth of flavor to this healthy spaghetti squash puttanesca. We love how the natural sweetness of the spaghetti squash compliments the robust goodness from the veggies. How To Make Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca Our delicious vegetarian dish only takes 15 minutes to prepare and about 40 minutes to cook. That said, you’ll have a healthy, low-carb pasta dish hot and ready in less than an hour! Creating this uber-impressive meal is super simple, too! Simply roast the spaghetti squash halves until they’re cooked all the way through, and then allow the vegetable to cool. Afterwards, roast the rest of the veggies with Italian seasoning, olive oil, and garlic for about 20-25 minutes, or until tender. Using a fork, shred your spaghetti squash into thin “spaghetti-like” strands, and blend it with your roasted veggies and chopped spinach. Before you know it, you’ll have a beautiful, Italian-inspired meal waiting for you to devour! So what are you waiting for? Dive into a big bowl of this delectable spaghetti squash puttanesca tonight! With only a fraction of the calories you’d find in conventional spaghetti puttanesca recipes, this healthy version will fix all your pasta cravings. Minus the guilt, of course! 3.88 from 16 votes Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca Spaghetti Squash Puttanesca is a great way to satisfy your pasta craving! Throw in those leftover roasted veggies for an extra nutrient and flavor boo

items.title: Heart-Healthy Valentine’s Day Recipes for Two!
items.content_excerpt: Home » Meal Planning » Recipe Collections » Heart-Healthy Valentine’s Day Recipes for Two! Recipe Collections Heart-Healthy Valentine’s Day Recipes for Two! by SkinnyMs. Pin Facebook Email Shares 59 Published: February 8, 2024 Creating the perfect menu plan for the most romantic day of the year! Who needs a fancy restaurant when you have romantic Valentine’s Day recipes of your own? Plus, by preparing your own Valentine’s meal, you get control over the nutritional content! Each of the delicious heart-healthy Valentine’s day recipes below contain ingredients that manage cholesterol and keep your blood vessels clear. What better day to look after your heart than on Valentine’s Day? Heart-Healthy Valentine’s Day Recipes for Two! Start the day off right with any of these sweet and nutritious breakfasts. Romantic Chocolate Raspberry Pancakes Hello, decadence ! These gorgeous and sweet, chocolate raspberry pancakes are even more scrumptious than they look. If your Valentine has a sweet tooth, this recipe is sure to hit the spot! Try it: Romantic Chocolate Raspberry Pancakes Slow Cooker Hot Chocolate Steel-Cut Oatmeal This alternative oatmeal recipe gives you fiber and antioxidants. (And chocolate in the morning!) Here’s the recipe: Slow Cooker Hot Chocolate Steel-Cut Oatmeal Breakfast Yogurt Parfait What’s sexier than parfait? By choosing a granola with plenty of oats and nuts and adding blueberries as a fruit component, you’ll make this a low-fat and heart-healthy breakfast to enjoy with your Valentine. Give it a try: Breakfast Yogurt Parfait in a Jar How about a Lunch Date? Here are some light lunch ideas that are perfect for a Valentine’s day lunch date! Tortellini Pasta Salad There’s something about Italian-inspired food and Valentine’s Day that just feels right! And once you try this light yet satisfying pasta salad, you’ll understand why! This recipe makes several portions at just under 300 calories a piece. Serve up one serving (or two.. treat yourself!) for lunch, and enjoy the leftovers the following day! Try it: Tortellini Pasta Salad Greek Rice Stuffed Peppers This lunch recipe packs in fiber with brown rice, peppers, and carrots. Brown rice also contains niacin, a B vitamin that boosts HDL, otherwise known as the good cholesterol. Carrots deliver carotene, an antioxidant that promotes clean blood vessels. Choose red bell peppers for a big dose of carotene and lutein. To make for two, simply use two large peppers and reduce other ingredients by about 2/3. Make this recipe: Greek Rice Stuffed Peppers Grilled Chicken and Blueberry Salad This blueberry chicken salad combines lean protein with fiber-filled vegetables and fruit. Using baby spinach for the greens will pack in the lutein, folate, and fiber. Along with blueberries and slivered almonds, this recipe helps check cholesterol and keep your vessels healthy. Halve the recipe for two portions. Make it: Grilled Chicken and Blueberry Salad Romantic Dinner Ideas Celebrate a romantic night in w

items.title: Breakfast Quinoa
items.content_excerpt: Home » Recipes » Breakfast Quinoa Recipes Breakfast Quinoa No ratings yet by SkinnyMs. Jump to Recipe Pin Facebook Email Shares 6.2k Published: February 7, 2024 Nothing beats waking up to this energy-boosting bowl of quinoa! This recipe spotlights quinoa, one of our favorite superfoods. This nutritional powerhouse will blow you away with its laundry list of health benefits. Coined the “supergrain of the future,” quinoa lowers cholesterol levels, supports healthy brain function, boosts your metabolism, and much, much more! Why not rise and shine to breakfast quinoa? Deliciously sweet and savory, this recipe has you cooking quinoa in your choice of milk with a drizzle of honey. Breakfast Quinoa Recipe There’s nothing like starting your day with a warm, satisfying bowl of porridge. Let me introduce you to this nutty quinoa porridge – it has a delightfully thick and creamy texture that I think you’ll really enjoy. We’ve tossed in some juicy mixed berries to add a pop of sweetness, crunchy walnuts to give each bite some texture, and soft banana slices for a touch of natural sweetness. This energy-boosting bowl is packed with nutrients to keep you fueled all morning long. The quinoa gives you lasting energy while the fruit and nuts provide fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants. Breakfast Quinoa, the Perfect Kick Start Nutty quinoa delivers a thick, creamy consistency you’re bound to love. Complete with juicy berries, crunchy walnuts, and soft banana slices, each bowl includes all your favorite morning porridge toppings. Nothing beats waking up to this energy-boosting bowl of quinoa, certain to keep you full all morning long! The combination of flavors and textures is sure to make this a new morning favorite. Wake up to this bowl of goodness and feel ready to take on the day! No ratings yet Breakfast Quinoa Choosing quinoa for breakfast will soon become your new favorite way to energize your day. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Prep Time 5 minutes minutes Cook Time 20 minutes minutes Total Time 25 minutes minutes Yield 2 people Serving Size 1 bowl (1/2 of recipe) Course Breakfast Cuisine Universal Author SkinnyMs. Review Recipe PIN RECIPE Print Recipe Ingredients US Customary – Metric 1/2 cup quinoa pre-rinsed 1/8 teaspoon salt 2 tablespoons honey raw preferred 1/2 cup almond milk 1/2 cup blueberries fresh 1/4 cup walnuts coarsely chopped 1 banana sliced Instructions Add quinoa to a saucepan with 1 cup water and salt. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to a low-boil. Cook 15 minutes or until most of the water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork, and add milk and honey, stir to combine. Divide evenly among two bowls and top with almond milk, berries, banana slices, and nuts. Enjoy!
